title: Sri Rudram
author: Vedic Hymn (attributed to various Rishis)
introduction: Sri Rudram is a profound Vedic hymn dedicated to Lord Rudra (an epithet of Shiva). It is found in the Taittiriya Samhita of the Krishna Yajurveda. The text consists of two main parts: Namakam (salutations, 11 Anuvakas) and Chamakam (requests for blessings, 11 Anuvakas). Chanting the entire Sri Rudram is considered a powerful spiritual practice, believed to purify the mind, body, and surroundings, and bestow spiritual and material well-being.

chapters.name: Namakam - Anuvaka 1 (The Prayer for Peace)
chapters.summary: This section is a direct prayer to Lord Rudra, asking Him to turn away His fierce, destructive form (His bow and arrows) and manifest in His most auspicious and benevolent form, Shiva, for the peace and welfare of the world.

verses.original: ॐ नमो भगवते रुद्राय
verses.transliteration: oṃ namo bhagavate rudrāya

translations.english: Om. Salutations to the Adorable Lord Rudra.

verses.original: नमस्ते रुद्र मन्यव उतो त इषवे नमः । नमस्ते अस्तु धन्वने बाहुभ्यामुत ते नमः ॥
verses.transliteration: namas te rudra manyava uto ta iṣave namaḥ | namaste astu dhanvane bāhubhyāmuta te namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to your wrath, O Rudra, and salutations to your arrow. Salutations to your bow, and salutations also to your two arms.

verses.original: या त इषुः शिवतमा शिवं बभूव ते धनुः । शिवा शरव्या या तव तया नो रुद्र मृडय ॥
verses.transliteration: yā ta iṣuḥ śivatamā śivaṃ babhūva te dhanuḥ | śivā śaravyā yā tava tayā no rudra mṛḍaya ||

translations.english: That arrow of yours which is most auspicious, and your bow which has become benevolent, and your quiver which is gracious, with these, O Rudra, make us happy.

verses.original: या ते रुद्र शिवा तनूरघोराऽपापकाशिनी । तया नस्तनुवा शन्तमया गिरिशन्ताभि चाकशीहि ॥
verses.transliteration: yā te rudra śivā tanūraghorā'pāpakāśinī | tayā nastanuvā śaṃtamayā giriśaṃtābhi cākaśīhi ||

translations.english: O Rudra, O dweller in the mountains, with that body of yours which is auspicious, not terrible, and not revealing sin—with that most peaceful form, manifest Yourself to us.

verses.original: गिरिशन्त हस्तेन बिभर्ष्यस्तवे । शिवां गिरित्र तां कुरु मा हिंसीः पुरुषं जगत् ॥
verses.transliteration: giriśanta hastena bibharṣyastave | śivāṃ giritra tāṃ kuru mā hiṃsīḥ puruṣaṃ jagat ||

translations.english: O dweller in the mountains, you hold a weapon in your hand to throw. O protector of the mountains, make it peaceful, and do not injure any man or the world.

verses.original: शिवेन वचसा त्वा गिरिशाच्छा वदामसि । यथा नः सर्वमिज्जगदयक्ष्मं सुमना असत् ॥
verses.transliteration: śivena vacasā tvā girīśācchā vadāmasi | yathā naḥ sarvamijjagadayakṣmaṃ sumanā asat ||

translations.english: We invoke you, O mountain dweller, with auspicious words, so that all the world may be free from disease, and happy in spirit.

verses.original: अध्यवोचदधिवक्ता प्रथमो दैव्यो भिषक् । अहिश्र्च सर्वाञ्जम्भयन्त्सर्वाश्र्च यातुधान्यः ॥
verses.transliteration: adhyavocadadhivaktā prathamo daivyo bhiṣak | ahiśrca sarvāñjambhayantsarvāśrca yātudhānyaḥ ||

translations.english: May He (Rudra), the divine physician, the foremost advocate, speak on our behalf. May He crush all the snakes (of distress) and all the sorcerers.

verses.original: असौ यस्ताम्रो अरुण उत बभ्रुः सुमङ्गलः । ये चेमाँ रुद्रा अभितो दिक्षु श्रिताः सहस्रशोऽवैषाम् हेड ईमहे ॥
verses.transliteration: asau yas tāmro aruṇa uta babhruḥ sumaṅgalaḥ | ye cemām̐ rudrā abhito dikṣu śritāḥ sahasraśo’vaiṣām heḍa īmahe ||

translations.english: That Rudra, who is reddish-brown, copper-colored, and tawny, and who is highly auspicious; and those Rudras who are spread all around in the directions, in thousands—we desire to avert their wrath.

verses.original: असौ योऽवसर्पति नीलग्रीवो विलोहितः । उतैनं गोपा अदृश्रन्नदृश्रन्नुदहार्यः । उतैनं विश्वा भूतानि स दृष्टो मृडयाति नः ॥
verses.transliteration: asau yo’vasarpati nīlagrīvo vilohitaḥ | utainaṃ gopā adṛśrannadṛśrannudahāryaḥ | utainaṃ viśvā bhūtāni sa dṛṣṭo mṛḍayāti naḥ ||

translations.english: That one who moves about, the blue-necked and deeply red one—the cowherds saw Him, the women carrying water saw Him. May all beings see Him, and may He, when seen, bring happiness to us.

verses.original: नमोऽस्तु नीलग्रीवाय सहस्राक्षाय मीढुषे । अथो ये अस्य सत्वानोऽहं तेभ्योऽकरं नमः ॥
verses.transliteration: namo’stu nīlagrīvāya sahasrākṣāya mīḍhuṣe | atho ye asya satvāno’haṃ tebhyo’karaṃ namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the blue-necked, the thousand-eyed, the generous one. And those followers who are His—I offer salutations to them.

verses.original: प्रमुञ्च धन्व॑न॒स्त्वमु॒भयो॒रारत्नि॑यो॒र्ज्याम् । याश्च॑ ते॒ हस्त॒ इष॑वः॒ परा॒ ता भ॑गवो वप ॥
verses.transliteration: pramuñca dhanvana stvamubhayorārartniyōrjām | yāśca te hasta iṣavaḥ parā tā bhagavo vapa ||

translations.english: Release the string of your bow from both ends, and scatter far away those arrows which are in your hand, O Lord.

verses.original: अव॑तत्य॒ धनु॒स्त्वग् स॒हस्रा॑क्ष॒ शते॑षुधे । नि॒शीर्य॑ शल्या॒नां मुखो शि॒वो नः॑ सुम॒ना भ॑व ॥
verses.transliteration: avatatya dhanus tvag sahasrākṣa śateṣudhe | niśīrya śalyānāṃ mukho śivo naḥ sumanā bhava ||

translations.english: Unstring your bow, O thousand-eyed one with a hundred quivers. Disperse the points of the arrows, and be auspicious and benevolent to us.

verses.original: विज्या॑य॒ धनुः॑ कप॒र्दिनो॒ विशल्यो॒ बाण॑वा२ उत् । अने॒शन्नस्ये॑षव आ॒भुर॑स्य निष॒ङ्गथिः ॥
verses.transliteration: vijyāya dhanuḥ kapardino viśalyo bāṇavā ut | aneśannasyeṣava ābhurasya niṣaṅgathiḥ ||

translations.english: Unstring the bow of the one with matted locks, let the arrow quiver be without piercing points. Let His arrows be without power and the quiver be motionless.

verses.original: या ते॑ हे॒तिर्मी॑ढुष्टम॒ हस्ते॑ ब॒भूव॑ ते॒ धनुः॑ । तया॒स्मान्वि॒श्वत॒स्त्वम॑य॒क्ष्मया॒ परि॑भुज ॥
verses.transliteration: yā te hetir mīḍhuṣṭama haste babhūva te dhanuḥ | tayāsmān viśvatastva mayakṣmayā parībhuja ||

translations.english: That weapon of yours, O most generous one, and your bow that is in your hand—with that, protect us from all sides, free from disease.

verses.original: नम॑स्ते अ॒स्तु भ॑गव॒न्वि॒श्वेश्व॑राय महादे॒वाय॑ त्र्यम्ब॒काय॑ त्रिपु॒रान्त॒काय॑ त्रिका॒ग्निका॒लाय॑ का॒लाग्नि रु॒द्राय॑ नी॒लक॒ण्ठाय॑ मृ॒त्युञ्ज॒याय॑ सर्वेश्व॒राय॑ सदाशि॒वाय॑ श्री॒मन्म॑हादे॒वाय॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namas te astu bhagavan viśveśvarāya mahādevāya tryambakāya tripurāntakāya trikāgnikālāya kālāgni rudrāya nīlakaṇṭhāya mṛtyuñjayāya sarveśvarāya sadāśivāya śrīman mahādevāya namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to Thee, O Lord, the Lord of the Universe (Viśveśvara), the Great God (Mahādeva), the three-eyed one (Tryambaka), the destroyer of Tripura, the controller of the three sacrificial fires, Rudra as the fire of time, the blue-necked one, the conqueror of death, the Lord of all, the eternally auspicious one, the glorious Great God. Salutations.

verses.original: नमः॑ । रु॒द्रेभ्यो॒ ये दि॒वि येषां॒ वर्ष॒मिष॑वः । तेभ्यो॒ दश॒ प्राची॒र्दश॒ दक्षि॒णा दश॒ प्रतीची॒र्दशोदी॑ची॒र्दशो॒र्ध्वाः । तेभ्यो॒ नमो॑ अस्तु॒ ते नो॑ मृडयन्तु॒ ते यं द्वि॒ष्मो यश्च॑ नो॒ द्वेष्टि॒ तं वो॒ जम्भे॑ दधामि ॥
verses.transliteration: namaḥ | rudrebhyo ye divi yeṣāṃ varṣamiṣavaḥ | tebhyo daśa prācīr daśa dakṣiṇā daśa pratīcīr daśodīcīr daśordhvāḥ | tebhyo namo astu te no mṛḍayantu te yaṃ dviṣmo yaśca no dveṣti taṃ vo jambhe dadhāmi ||

translations.english: Salutations! Salutations to the Rudras in the sky, whose arrows are the rain. To them, ten salutations to the East, ten to the South, ten to the West, ten to the North, and ten above (fifty salutations). May they make us happy. The one whom we hate, and the one who hates us—him I cast into your jaws.

verses.original: ॐ शान्तिः शान्तिः शान्तिः ॥
verses.transliteration: oṃ śāntiḥ śāntiḥ śāntiḥ ||

translations.english: Om. Peace, Peace, Peace (in the three realms: physical, divine, and internal).

chapters.name: Namakam - Anuvaka 2 (The Omnipresent Rudra)
chapters.summary: Salutations to Rudra in His various manifestations as the source of all existence: the Lord of animals, forests, paths, food, and the four directions. He is worshipped in His forms both subtle and physical, golden and terrible.

verses.original: नमो॑ हिर॒ण्यबा॑हवे से॒नान्ये॑ दि॒शां च॒ पत॑ये॒ नमः॑ । नमो॑ वृ॒क्षेभ्यो॒ हरि॑केशेभ्यः पशू॒नां पत॑ये॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo hiraṇyabāhave senānye diśāṃ ca pataye namaḥ | namo vṛkṣebhyo harikeśebhyaḥ paśūnāṃ pataye namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the one with golden arms, to the commander of armies, and to the lord of the directions. Salutations to the trees with green foliage (or golden hair), and to the lord of animals.

verses.original: नमः॑ स॒स्पिञ्ज॑राय॒ त्विषी॑मते पथी॒नां पत॑ये॒ नमः॑ । नमो॑ बभ्लु॒शाय॑ विव्या॒धिनेऽन्ना॑नां॒ पत॑ये॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namaḥ saspiñjarāya tviṣīmate pathīnāṃ pataye namaḥ | namo babhluśāya vivyādhine'nnānāṃ pataye namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the one who is golden-red and radiant, and to the lord of paths. Salutations to the tawny one, who pierces (foes), and to the lord of food.

verses.original: नमो॒ हरि॑केशायो॒पवी॒तिने॑ पु॒ष्टानां॒ पत॑ये॒ नमः॑ । नमो॑ भ॒वस्य॑ हे॒त्यै जग॑तां॒ पत॑ये॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo harikeśāyopavītine puṣṭānāṃ pataye namaḥ | namo bhavasya hetyai jagatāṃ pataye namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the one with green foliage (or golden hair), wearing the sacred thread, and to the lord of the nourished (or cattle). Salutations to the cause of existence (Bhava), the destroyer, and to the lord of the worlds.

verses.original: नमो॑ रु॒द्राय॑ तत॒ताविने॑ क्षेत्राणां॒ पत॑ये॒ नमः॑ । नमः॑ सू॒तायाह॑न्त्याय॒ वना॑नां॒ पत॑ये॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo rudrāya tatatāvine kṣetrāṇāṃ pataye namaḥ | namaḥ sūtāyāhantyāya vanānāṃ pataye namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to Rudra, the one who expands and pervades, and to the lord of fields. Salutations to the charioteer, the unconquered, and to the lord of forests.

verses.original: नमो॒ रोहि॑ताय स्थ॒पत॑ये वृ॒क्षाणां॒ पत॑ये॒ नमः॑ । नमो॑ म॒न्त्रिणे॑ वाणि॒जाय॒ कक्षा॑णां॒ पत॑ये॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo rohitāya sthapataye vṛkṣāṇāṃ pataye namaḥ | namo mantriṇe vāṇijāya kakṣāṇāṃ pataye namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the red one, the architect (builder), and to the lord of trees. Salutations to the counselor, the merchant, and to the lord of hidden places (secret forests or hidden wisdom).

verses.original: नमो॑ भुव॒न्तये॑ वारिवस्कृ॒तायौष॑धीनां॒ पत॑ये॒ नमः॑ । नम॑ उ॒च्चैर्घो॑षायाक्रन्द॒यते॑ पत्ती॒नां पत॑ये॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo bhuvantaye vārivaskṛtāyauṣadhīnāṃ pataye namaḥ | nama uccairghoṣāyākrandayate pattīnāṃ pataye namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the one who creates beings, the giver of wealth, and to the lord of herbs. Salutations to the one with loud shouts, who causes crying (or commands), and to the lord of foot soldiers.

verses.original: नमः॑ कृत्स्नवी॒ताय॒ धाव॑ते॒ सत्त्व॑नां॒ पत॑ये॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namaḥ kṛtsnavītāya dhāvate sattvanāṃ pataye namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the one who is completely encircled (by cosmic energy), who runs swiftly, and to the lord of courageous beings.

verses.original: नमो॑ स॒हमा॑नाय निव्या॒धिन॑ आ॒व्या॒धिनि॑नां॒ पत॑ये॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo sahamānāya nivyādhina āvyādhinīnāṃ pataye namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the one who overcomes all, who wounds (the enemies), and to the lord of those who seek to wound others.

verses.original: नमः॑ ककु॒भाय॑ निष॒ङ्गिणे॑ स्te॒नानां॒ पत॑ये॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namaḥ kakubhāya niṣaṅgiṇe stenānāṃ pataye namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the one of prominence (or with a hump), bearing a quiver, and to the lord of thieves.

verses.original: नमो॑ निष॒ङ्गिणे॑ इषुधि॒मते॑ तस्कराणां॒ पत॑ये॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo niṣaṅgiṇe iṣudhimate taskarāṇāṃ pataye namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the one bearing a quiver, equipped with arrows, and to the lord of robbers.

verses.original: नमो॒ वञ्च॑ते परि॒वञ्च॑ते स्तायू॒नां पत॑ये॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo vañcate parivañcate stāyūnāṃ pataye namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the one who cheats, who cheats all around, and to the lord of pilferers.

verses.original: नमो॑ निचे॒रवे॑ परिच॒रायार॑ण्यानां॒ पत॑ये॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo nicerave paricarāyāraṇyānāṃ pataye namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the one who moves about secretly, who moves everywhere, and to the lord of forest dwellers.

verses.original: नम॑स् सृका॒विभ्यो॒ जिघां॑सद्भ्यो मुष्ण॒तां पत॑ये॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namas sṛkāvibhyo jighāṃsadbhyo muṣṇatāṃ pataye namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to those who possess sharp instruments (like spears), who desire to kill, and to the lord of plunderers.

verses.original: नमो॑ असि॒मद्भ्यो॒ नक्तं॒ चर॑द्भ्यः प्रकृ॒न्तानां॒ पत॑ये॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo asimadbhyo naktaṃ caradbhyah prakṛntānāṃ pataye namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to those who bear swords, who move about at night, and to the lord of executioners (or the violent).

verses.original: नम॑ उष्णी॒षिणे॑ गिरिच॒राय॑ कुलुञ्चानां॒ पत॑ये॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: nama uṣṇīṣiṇe giricarāya kuluñcānāṃ pataye namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the one wearing a turban, who roams the mountains, and to the lord of criminals (or wanderers).

verses.original: नम॑ इषु॒मद्भ्यो॑ धन्व॒।आयुध॒म्यश्च॑ तः॒ भ्यश्च॒ वो नमो॒ नम॑ आ॒तन्व॒द्भ्यः प्रति॑दधाने॒भ्यश्च॒ वो नमो॒ नम॑ आ॒यच्छ॑द्भ्यो विसृ॒जद्भ्य॑श्च॒ वो नमो॒ नम॑स्स॒ज्मत्भ्यो॑ नि॒षङ्गिभ्य॑श्च॒ वो नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: nama iṣumadbhyo dhanva āyudhamyaśca taḥ bhyaśca vo namo nama ātanvadbhyaḥ pratidadhānebhyaśca vo namo nama āyacchadbhyo visṛjadbhyaśca vo namo namassajmatbhyo niṣaṅgibhyaśca vo namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to those who bear arrows and those who carry bows. Salutations to those who stretch the bowstrings and those who fit the arrows. Salutations to those who pull back the arrows and those who release them. Salutations to those who are ready for battle and those who bear quivers.

verses.original:
नमो॑ हिर॒ण्यबा॑हवे॒ हिर॒ण्यव॑र्णाय हिर॒ण्यरूपाय हिर॒ण्यपत॑ये॒
ऽम्बिका॑पतय उमापतये पशुप॒तये॒ नमो॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo hiraṇyabāhave hiraṇyavarṇāya hiraṇyarūpāya hiraṇyapataye’mbikāpataya umāpataye paśupataye namo namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the one with golden arms, of golden color, of golden form, the Lord of gold, the consort of Ambika, the consort of Uma, the Lord of all beings. Salutations.

verses.original: ए॒षां ते॑ रुद्रा मृड॒याति॒ तस्मै॒ जम्भे॑ दधामि ॥
verses.transliteration: eṣām̐ te rudrā mṛḍayāti tasmai jambhe dadhāmi ||

translations.english: May these Rudras make us happy. The one whom we hate and the one who hates us—him I cast into your jaws.

chapters.name: Namakam - Anuvaka 3 (The Cosmic Archer and Dweller)
chapters.summary: This section addresses Rudra as the supreme archer and the cosmic warrior, invoking Him as the source of all weapons, both drawn and undrawn. He is saluted as the dweller of mountains, rivers, and all places where life and death intersect.

verses.original: नमो॑ भ॒वाय॑ च रु॒द्राय॑ च॒ नमः॒ शर्वा॑य च पशुप॒तये॑ च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo bhavāya ca rudrāya ca namaḥ śarvāya ca paśupataye ca namaḥ ||

verses.original: नमः॒ स्रोत्या॑य च॒ द्वीप्य॑य च॒ नमः॑ कु॒ल्या॑य च॒ गर्ज॑याय च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namaḥ srotyāya ca dvīpyaya ca namaḥ kulyāya ca garjayāya ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the one in the currents and the one in the islands. Salutations to the one in the canals and the one who makes thunderous noise.

verses.original: नमो॑ म॒न्त्र्या॑य च॒ वाणि॒जाय॑ च॒ नमः॑ क॒क्षा॑य च॒ क॒षाय॑ च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo mantryāya ca vāṇijāya ca namaḥ kakṣāya ca kaṣāya ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the counselor and the merchant. Salutations to the one in the thicket and the one who scrapes (or digs).

verses.original: नमः॑ पृ॒ष्ठ्या॑य च॒ नाड्या॑य च॒ नमो॑ भ॒व॑य च रु॒द्राय॑ च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namaḥ pṛṣṭhyāya ca nāḍyāya ca namo bhavāya ca rudrāya ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the one on the surface (the ridge) and the one in the channels (veins). Salutations to Bhava and to Rudra.

chapters.name: Namakam - Anuvaka 6 (Rudra as the Creator and Destroyer)
chapters.summary: This section salutes Rudra as the creator and destroyer, associating him with various celestial beings, forests, and trees. He is worshipped as the one with a thousand eyes (omniscience) and a hundred bows.

verses.original: नमो॑ ग॒णेभ्यो॑ ग॒णप॑तिभ्यश्च वो॒ नमो॒ नमो॒ विरू॑पेभ्यो वि॒श्वरू॑पेभ्यश्च वो॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo gaṇebhyo gaṇapatibhyaśca vo namo namo virūpebhyaśca viśvarūpebhyaśca vo namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the groups (of followers) and to their leaders. Salutations to the deformed and to the multi-formed (omnipresent) ones.

verses.original: नमो॑ म॒हद्भ्यः॑ क्षुल्ल॒केभ्य॑श्च वो॒ नमो॒ नमो॑ र॒थिभ्यो॒ ऽरथेभ्य॑श्च वो॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo mahadbhyaḥ kṣullakebhyaśca vo namo namo rathibhyo 'rathebhyaśca vo namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the great and to the small. Salutations to those with chariots and to those without chariots.

verses.original: नमो॒ रथेभ्य॑श्च रथप॑तिभ्यश्च वो॒ नमो॒ नमः॑ से॒नाभ्य॑स्सेना॒निभ्य॑श्च वो॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo rathebhyaśca rathapatibhyaśca vo namo namaḥ senābhya ssenānibhyaśca vo namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the chariots and to the lords of chariots. Salutations to the armies and to the commanders of the armies.

verses.original: नमः॑ क्ष॒त्तृभ्यः॑ सङ्ग्रही॒तृभ्य॑श्च वो॒ नमो॒ नम॒स्तक्ष॑भ्यो रथका॒रेभ्य॑श्च वो॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namaḥ kṣattṛbhyaḥ saṅgrahītṛbhyaśca vo namo namastakṣabhyo rathakārebhyaśca vo namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the doorkeepers (or providers) and to the collectors. Salutations to the carpenters and to the chariot makers.

verses.original: नमः॒ कुला॑लेभ्यः कर्म॒रेभ्य॑श्च वो॒ नमो॒ नमः॑ पु॒ञ्जिष्टे॑भ्यो निषा॒देभ्य॑श्च वो॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namaḥ kulālebhyaḥ karmārebhyaśca vo namo namaḥ puñjiṣṭebhyo niṣādebhyaśca vo namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the potters and to the metal workers (blacksmiths). Salutations to the fowlers (or fishermen) and to the hunters.

verses.original: नम॑ इषु॒कृद्भ्यो॑ धन्कृ॒द्भ्यश्च॑ वो॒ नमो॒ नमः॑ मृग॒युभ्यः॑ श्व॒निभ्य॑श्च वो॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: nama iṣukṛdbhyo dhankṛdbhyaśca vo namo namaḥ mṛgayubhyaḥ śvanibhyaśca vo namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the arrow makers and to the bow makers. Salutations to the hunters and to the dog-keepers (or those who live by dogs).

verses.original: नमः॒ श्वभ्यः॑ श्वप॑तिभ्यश्च वो॒ नमो॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namaḥ śvabhyaḥ śvapatibhyaśca vo namo namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the dogs and to the owners of dogs. Salutations.

verses.original: नम॑स्सो॒मेभ्यो॒ ऽसो॑meभ्यश्च वो॒ नमो॒ नम॑ आ॒दित्येभ्य॑श्चादि॒त्येभ्य॑श्च वो॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namassomebhyo 'somebhyaśca vo namo nama ādityebhyaścādityebhyaśca vo namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to those who perform Soma sacrifice and to those who do not. Salutations to those who are luminous (sons of Aditi) and to those who are not.

verses.original: नमो॑ य॒ज्ञेभ्यो॑ य॒ज्ञप॑तिभ्यश्च वो॒ नमो॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo yajñebhyo yajñapatibhyaśca vo namo namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the sacrifices and to the lords of the sacrifices. Salutations.

verses.original: नम॑स्सुवि॒त्तेभ्यो॒ दुर्वि॒त्तेभ्य॑श्च वो॒ नमो॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namassuvittebhyo durvittebhyaśca vo namo namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to those with good wealth and to those with bad wealth. Salutations.

verses.original: नम॒श्श्रोमेभ्यो॒ ऽश्रोमेभ्य॑श्च वो॒ नमो॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namaśśromebhyo 'śromebhyaśca vo namo namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to those who toil and to those who do not toil. Salutations.

verses.original: नमः॑ पू॒र्षदेभ्यः॑ पृ॒ष्ठदेभ्य॑श्च वो॒ नमो॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namaḥ pūrṣadebhyaḥ pṛṣṭhadebhyaśca vo namo namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to those who are in front and to those who are in the back. Salutations.

verses.original: नमो॒ गिरिकृद्भ्यो॒ ऽद्रिकृद्भ्यश्च॑ वो॒ नमो॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo girikṛdbhyo 'drikṛdbhyaśca vo namo namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to those who make mountains and to those who make stones. Salutations.

verses.original: नमो॒ वृक्ष॑केभ्यो॒ हरि॑केशेभ्यश्च वो॒ नमो॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo vṛkṣakebhyo harikeśebhyaśca vo namo namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the small trees and to the trees with green foliage (or golden hair). Salutations.

verses.original: नम॒स्तोमेभ्य॒स्तोभ्रेभ्य॑श्च वो॒ नमो॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namastomebhyastobhrebhyaśca vo namo namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the praises (hymns) and to the singers of praises. Salutations.

chapters.name: Namakam - Anuvaka 7 (The Young and the Old)
chapters.summary: Salutations to the oldest (Jyeshtha) and the youngest (Kanishtha), the one born before (Purvaja) and after (Aparaja). This acknowledges his presence across all time and in all stages of evolution.

verses.original: नमो॑ भ॒वाय॑ च रु॒द्राय॑ च॒ नमः॒ शर्वा॑य च पशुप॒तये॑ च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo bhavāya ca rudrāya ca namaḥ śarvāya ca paśupataye ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to **Bhava** (the source of existence) and to **Rudra** (the dispeller of misery). Salutations to **Sharva** (the destroyer) and to **Pashupati** (the lord of all beings).

verses.original: नमो॑ नीलग्री॒वाय॑ च शिति॒कण्ठा॑य च॒ नमः॑ कफ॒र्दिने॑ च॒ व्यु॑प्तकेशाय च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo nīlagrīvāya ca śitikāṇṭhāya ca namaḥ kapardine ca vyuptakeśāya ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the **Blue-throated** (Nīlagrīva) and the **white-throated** (Śitikāṇṭha). Salutations to the one with **matted locks** (Kapardin) and the one with shaven head.

verses.original: नमः॑ स॒हस्रा॒क्षाय॑ च शतध॒न्वने॑ च॒ नमो॑ गिरि॒शाय॑ च शिपिवि॒ष्टाय॑ च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namaḥ sahasrākṣāya ca śatadhanvane ca namo giriśāya ca śipiviṣṭāya ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the **thousand-eyed** one and the wielder of a hundred bows. Salutations to the **dweller of the mountain** and the one who is **radiant** (or pervaded by rays).

verses.original: नमो॑ मी॒ढुष्ट॑माay॒ चेषु॑मते च॒ नमो॑ ह्र॒स्वाay॑ च वाम॒नाय॑ च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo mīḍhuṣṭamāya ceṣumate ca namo hrasvāya ca vāmanāya ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the **most generous** one and the **arrow-bearer**. Salutations to the **short** one and the **dwarf** (Vāmana).

verses.original: नमो॑ बृ॒ह॒te च॒ वर्षि॑याय च॒ नमो॑ वृ॒द्धाय॑ च स॒ंवृध्व॑ने च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo bṛhate ca varṣīyāya ca namo vṛddhāya ca saṃvṛdhvane ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the **vast** one and the **most ancient**. Salutations to the **old** one and the one who **increases growth**.

verses.original: नमो॒ अग्रि॑याय च प्रथ॒माय॑ च॒ नम॑ आ॒शवे॑ चाजि॒राय॑ च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo agriyāya ca prathamāya ca nama āśave cājirāya ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the **foremost** and the **first**. Salutations to the **swift** and the **rapidly moving**.

verses.original: नम॑श्शी॒घ्राय॑ च शीभ्॒राय॑ च॒ नमो॑ ऊ॒rmyāya॑ चावस्व॒न्याय॑ च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namaśśīghrāya ca śībhrāya ca namo ūrmyāya cāvasvanyāya ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the **quick** and the **readily available**. Salutations to the one in the **waves** and the one in the **still waters**.

verses.original: नमः॑ स्त्रोत॒स्याय॑ च द्वी॒प्याय॑ च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namaḥ strotasyāya ca dvīpyāya ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the one in the **currents** (streams) and the one in the **islands**.

verses.original: नमो॑ ज्ये॒ष्ठाय॑ च कनि॒ष्ठाय॑ च॒ नमः॑ पूर्व॒जाय॑ चापर॒जाय॑ च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo jyeṣṭhāya ca kaniṣṭhāya ca namaḥ pūrvajāya cāparajāya ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the **oldest** and the **youngest**. Salutations to the one **born before** (Pūrvaja) and the one **born after** (Aparaja).

verses.original: नमो॑ मध्य॒माय॑ चापग॒ल्भाय॑ च॒ नमो॑ जघ॒न्या॑य च॒ बुध्नि॒याय॑ च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo madhyamāya cāpagalbhāya ca namo jaghanyāya ca budhniyāya ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the **middle** one and the **immature** one. Salutations to the one in the **background** and the one in the **foundation** (or depth).

verses.original: नमः॑ शो॒भ्या॑य च प्रतिस॒र्या॑य च॒ नमो॒ याम्या॑य च॒ क्षेम्या॑य च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namaḥ śobhyāya ca pratisaryāya ca namo yāmyāya ca kṣemyāya ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the one born in the **assembly** and the one who **moves around**. Salutations to the one in the **south** (Yama's direction) and the one in the **safety** (or well-being).

verses.original: नम॑ उ॒र्वर्या॑य च॒ खल्या॑य च॒ नमः॒ श्लोक्या॑य चाऽवसा॒न्याय॑ च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: nama urvaryāya ca khalyāya ca namaḥ ślokyāya cā'vasānyāya ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the one in the **fields** and the one in the **threshing floor**. Salutations to the **famous** one and the one at the **end** (or cessation).

verses.original: नमो॒ वन्या॑य च॒ कक्ष्या॑य च॒ नमः॑ श्र॒वाय॑ च प्रतिश्र॒वाय॑ च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo vanyāya ca kakṣyāya ca namaḥ śravāya ca pratiśravāya ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the one in the **forest** and the one in the **thicket**. Salutations to the one who is **heard** (fame) and the one who **responds** (echo).

verses.original: नम॑ आ॒शुषे॑णाय चा॒शुर॑थाय च॒ नमः॑ शू॒राय॑ चावभिन्द॒ते च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: nama āśuṣeṇāya cāśurathāya ca namaḥ śūrāya cāvabhindate ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the one with a **swift army** and the one with a **swift chariot**. Salutations to the **hero** and the one who **pierces through** (the enemy lines).

verses.original: नमो॑ वर्मि॒णे च॑ वरू॒थिने॑ च॒ नमः॑ प्रकृ॒तीनां॒ पत॑ये च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo varmiṇe ca varūthine ca namaḥ prakṛtīnāṃ pataye ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the one wearing **armor** and the one wearing **protective gear**. Salutations to the **lord of nature** (Prakṛtis) and the creatures.

chapters.name: Namakam - Anuvaka 8 (The Mahamrityunjaya Mantra)
chapters.summary: The most significant part of the Namakam, containing the powerful Mahamrityunjaya Mantra. This section is a prayer for spiritual wisdom, health, prosperity, and liberation from the cycle of death, through the grace of Tryambaka (Shiva).

verses.original: नमो॑ दे॒वानां᳚ हृद॒येभ्यो॒ नमो॒ विष्णे॑वे च ककु॒भाय॑ च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo devānām̐ hṛdayebhyo namo viṣṇeve ca kakubhāya ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the hearts of the gods (which contain Rudra). Salutations to the pervader (Vishnu) and to the prominent one.

verses.original: नमो॑ वि॒श्वाहा॑य च॒ विश्व॑देवाय च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo viśvāhāya ca viśvadevāya ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the omnipresent and to the universal God.

verses.original: नमो॒ मह॒ते च॑ क्षुल्ल॒काय॑ च॒ नमो॑ वृ॒द्धाय॑ च वरू॒थिने॑ च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo mahate ca kṣullakāya ca namo vṛddhāya ca varūthine ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the great and to the small. Salutations to the old (ancient) and to the one with protective covering.

verses.original: नमो॑ वर्मि॒णे च॑ वरू॒थिने॑ च॒ नमः॑ प्रकृ॒तीनां॒ पत॑ये च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo varmiṇe ca varūthine ca namaḥ prakṛtīnāṃ pataye ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the one wearing armor and the one wearing protective gear. Salutations to the lord of nature (Prakṛtis) and the creatures.

verses.original: नमो॑ दुन्दु॒भ्याय॑ चाहन॒न्या॑य च॒ नमो॑ धृ॒ष्णवे॑ च प्रमृ॒शाय॑ च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo dundubhyāya cāhananyāya ca namo dhṛṣṇave ca pramṛśāya ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the one in the war drum (Dundubhi) and the one struck by the drum stick. Salutations to the bold one and the one who probes (the enemy).

verses.original: नमो॑ दू॒ताय॑ च॒ प्रहि॑ताय च॒ नमो॑ निष॒ङ्गिणे॑ चेषुधि॒मते॑ च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo dūtāya ca prahitāya ca namo niṣaṅgiṇe ceṣudhimate ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the messenger (Dūta) and the one sent out. Salutations to the one bearing a quiver and the one equipped with arrows.

verses.original: नमो॑ ती॒क्ष्णेष॑वे चा॒युधि॒ने च॒ नमः॑ स्वायु॒धाय॑ च सु॒धन्व॑ने च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo tīkṣṇeṣave cāyudhine ca namaḥ svāyudhāya ca sudhanvane ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the one with sharp arrows and the one bearing weapons. Salutations to the one with excellent weapons and the one with a good bow.

verses.original:
नमो॒ हिर॑ण्यबाहवे॒ हिर॑ण्यवर्णाय॒ हिर॑ण्यरूपाय॒ हिर॑ण्यपतये॒
ऽम्बिका॑पतय उमापतये पशुप॒तये॒ नमो॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo hiraṇyabāhave hiraṇyavarṇāya hiraṇyarūpāya hiraṇyapataye'mbikāpataya umāpataye paśupataye namo namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the one with golden arms, of golden color, of golden form, the Lord of gold, the consort of Ambika, the consort of Uma, the Lord of all beings. Salutations.

verses.original: ॐ त्र्यम्बकं यजामहे सुगन्धिं पुष्टिवर्धनम्। उर्वारुकमिव बन्धनान्मृत्योर्मुक्षीय माऽमृतात्॥
verses.transliteration: oṃ tryambakaṃ yajāmahe sugandhiṃ puṣṭivardhanam | urvārukamiva bandhanānmṛtyormukṣīya mā'mṛtāt ||

translations.english: We worship the Three-eyed Lord (Tryambaka), who is fragrant and nourishes all beings. May He liberate us from the bondage of death, like a cucumber from its stalk, but not from immortality.

verses.original: यश्च॒ विश्वा॑स्य॒ यातुं ध्रुवा॒ वस्तोः॑ प॒ते॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: yaśca viśvāsyā yātuṃ dhruvā vastoḥ pate namaḥ ||

translations.english: And He who is fixed (constant) and moves about. Salutations to the Lord of the dwelling place.

verses.original: नमो॑ भू॒तये॑ भू॒तभा॒विने॑ च॒ नमो॑ भू॒तये॑ च भा॒विने॑ च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo bhūtaye bhūtabhāvine ca namo bhūtaye ca bhāvine ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the source of being and to the nourisher of being. Salutations to the past and to the future.

verses.original: नमो॒ विश्वा॑स्य॒ यातुं ध्रुवा॒ वस्तोः॑ प॒ते॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo viśvāsyā yātuṃ dhruvā vastoḥ pate namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the pervader (Vishnu) and to the prominent one.

verses.original: नमो॑ दे॒वानां᳚ हृद॒yeभ्यो॒ नमो॒ विष्णे॑वे च ककु॒भाय॑ च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo devānām̐ hṛdayebhyo namo viṣṇeve ca kakubhāya ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the hearts of the gods (which contain Rudra). Salutations to the pervader (Vishnu) and to the prominent one.

verses.original: नमो॒ मह॒ते च॑ क्षुल्ल॒काय॑ च॒ नमो॑ वृ॒द्धाय॑ च वरू॒थिने॑ च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo mahate ca kṣullakāya ca namo vṛddhāya ca varūthine ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the great and to the small. Salutations to the old (ancient) and to the one with protective covering.

verses.original: नमः॑ पू॒र्वाय॑ च सा॒यं च॒ नमः॑ प॒श्चा॑य च॒ दक्षि॑णाय च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namaḥ pūrvāya ca sāyam ca namaḥ paścāya ca dakṣiṇāya ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the one in the east and the one in the evening. Salutations to the one in the west and the one in the south.

chapters.name: Namakam - Anuvaka 9 (The Lord of the Universe)
chapters.summary: Salutations to Rudra as the Lord of the paths, the source of wind (Vāta) and Brahman. He is invoked as the divine healer and the provider of auspiciousness, granting protection in all situations and realms.

verses.original: नमो॑ भ॒वाय॑ च रु॒द्राय॑ च॒ नमः॒ शर्वा॑य च पशुप॒तये॑ च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo bhavāya ca rudrāya ca namaḥ śarvāya ca paśupataye ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to **Bhava** (the source of existence) and to **Rudra** (the dispeller of misery). Salutations to **Sharva** (the destroyer) and to **Pashupati** (the lord of all beings).

verses.original: नमो॑ नीलग्री॒वाय॑ च शिति॒कण्ठा॑य च॒ नमः॑ कप॒र्दिने॑ च॒ व्यु॑प्तकेशाय च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo nīlagrīvāya ca śitikāṇṭhāya ca namaḥ kapardine ca vyuptakeśāya ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the **Blue-throated** (Nīlagrīva) and the **white-throated** (Śitikāṇṭha). Salutations to the one with **matted locks** (Kapardin) and the one with shaven head.

verses.original: नमः॑ सहस्रा॒क्षाय॑ च शतध॒न्वने॑ च॒ नमो॑ गिरि॒शाय॑ च शिपिवि॒ष्टाय॑ च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namaḥ sahasrākṣāya ca śatadhanvane ca namo giriśāya ca śipiviṣṭāya ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the **thousand-eyed** one and the wielder of a hundred bows. Salutations to the **dweller of the mountain** and the one who is **radiant** (or pervaded by rays).

verses.original: नमो॑ मी॒ढुष्ट॑माय॒ चेषु॑मते च॒ नमो॑ ह्र॒स्वाay॑ च वाम॒नाय॑ च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo mīḍhuṣṭamāya ceṣumate ca namo hrasvāya ca vāmanāya ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the **most generous** one and the **arrow-bearer**. Salutations to the **short** one and the **dwarf** (Vāmana).

verses.original: नमो॑ बृ॒ह॒ते च॒ वर्षि॑याय च॒ नमो॑ वृ॒द्धाय॑ च स॒ंवृध्व॑ने च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo bṛhate ca varṣīyāya ca namo vṛddhāya ca saṃvṛdhvane ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the **vast** one and the **most ancient**. Salutations to the **old** one and the one who **increases growth**.

verses.original: नमो॒ अग्रि॑yaाय च प्रथ॒माय॑ च॒ नम॑ आ॒शवे॑ चाजि॒राय॑ च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo agriyāya ca prathamāya ca nama āśave cājirāya ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the **foremost** and the **first**. Salutations to the **swift** and the **rapidly moving**.

verses.original: नम॑श्शी॒घ्राय॑ च शीभ्॒राय॑ च॒ नमो॑ ऊ॒र्म्याय॑ चावस्व॒न्याय॑ च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namaśśīghrāya ca śībhrāya ca namo ūrmyāya cāvasvanyāya ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the **quick** and the **readily available**. Salutations to the one in the **waves** and the one in the **still waters**.

verses.original: नमः॑ स्त्रोत॒स्याय॑ च द्वी॒प्याय॑ च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namaḥ strotasyāya ca dvīpyāya ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the one in the **currents** (streams) and the one in the **islands**.

verses.original: नमो॑ ज्ये॒ष्ठाय॑ च कनि॒ष्ठाय॑ च॒ नमः॑ पूर्व॒जाय॑ चापर॒जाय॑ च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo jyeṣṭhāya ca kaniṣṭhāya ca namaḥ pūrvajāya cāparajāya ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the **oldest** and the **youngest**. Salutations to the one **born before** (Pūrvaja) and the one **born after** (Aparaja).

verses.original: नमो॑ मध्य॒माय॑ चापग॒ल्भाय॑ च॒ नमो॑ जघ॒न्या॑य च॒ बुध्नि॒याय॑ च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo madhyamāya cāpagalbhāya ca namo jaghanyāya ca budhniyāya ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the **middle** one and the **immature** one. Salutations to the one in the **background** and the one in the **foundation** (or depth).

verses.original: नमः॑ शो॒भ्या॑य च प्रतिस॒र्या॑य च॒ नमो॒ याम्या॑य च॒ क्षेम्या॑य च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namaḥ śobhyāya ca pratisaryāya ca namo yāmyāya ca kṣemyāya ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the one born in the **assembly** and the one who **moves around**. Salutations to the one in the **south** (Yama's direction) and the one in the **safety** (or well-being).

verses.original: नम॑ उ॒र्वर्या॑य च॒ खल्या॑य च॒ नमः॒ श्लोक्या॑य चाऽवसा॒न्याय॑ च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: nama urvaryāya ca khalyāya ca namaḥ ślokyāya cā'vasānyāya ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the one in the **fields** and the one in the **threshing floor**. Salutations to the **famous** one and the one at the **end** (or cessation).

verses.original: नमो॒ वन्या॑य च॒ कक्ष्या॑य च॒ नमः॑ श्र॒वाय॑ च प्रतिश्र॒वाय॑ च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo vanyāya ca kakṣyāya ca namaḥ śravāya ca pratiśravāya ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the one in the **forest** and the one in the **thicket**. Salutations to the one who is **heard** (fame) and the one who **responds** (echo).

verses.original: नम॑ आ॒शुषे॑णाय चा॒शुर॑थाय च॒ नमः॑ शू॒राय॑ चावभिन्द॒ते च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: nama āśuṣeṇāya cāśurathāya ca namaḥ śūrāya cāvabhindate ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the one with a **swift army** and the one with a **swift chariot**. Salutations to the **hero** and the one who **pierces through** (the enemy lines).

verses.original: नमो॑ वर्मि॒णे च॑ वरू॒थिने॑ च॒ नमः॑ प्रकृ॒तीनां॒ पत॑ये च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo varmiṇe ca varūthine ca namaḥ prakṛtīnāṃ pataye ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the one wearing **armor** and the one wearing **protective gear**. Salutations to the **lord of nature** (Prakṛtis) and the creatures.

chapters.name: Namakam - Anuvaka 10 (The Benevolent Forms of Shiva)
chapters.summary: This section contains the famous prayer seeking the most gentle and peaceful form of Rudra (Shiva). It is a request for peace (Shaṁ) from all directions and a final plea for His protection from all harm and fear.

verses.original: नमस्ते॑ अस्तु भगव॒न्विश्वे॑श्वराय महादे॒वाय॑ त्र्यम्ब॒काय॑ त्रिपुरान्त॒काय॑ त्रिकाग्निका॒लाय॑ कालाग्निरu॒द्राय॑ नीलक॒ण्ठाय॑ मृ॑त्युञ्ज॒याय॑ सर्वेश्व॒राय॑ सदाशि॒वाय॑ श्रीमन्म॒हादे॒वाय॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namaste astu bhagavan viśveśvarāya mahādevāya tryambakāya tripurāntakāya trikāgnikālāya kālāgnirudrāya nīlakaṇṭhāya mṛtyuñjayāya sarveśvarāya sadāśivāya śrīmanmahādevāya namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to Thee, O Lord, the Lord of the universe, the Great God, the three-eyed one, the destroyer of Tripura, the annihilator of the three fires, Rudra as the fire of time, the blue-throated one, the conqueror of death, the Lord of all, the ever-auspicious one, the glorious Great God. Salutations.

verses.original: य ईशा॑न॒स्य॒ भुवन॑स्य वि॒राट् इ॒ह स॑र्वव्या॒पी नम॑स्सदाशि॒वाय॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: ya īśānasyā bhuvanasya virāṭ iha sarvavyāpī namassadāśivāya ||

translations.english: To him, the Sovereign Ruler of the universe, the all-pervading one here (in the world). Salutations to Sadashiva (the ever-auspicious one).

verses.original: अ॒तो॑ ह॒ त्वं नः॑ प॒रमे॑ण पा॒नस्य॑ श॒तं नः॑ स॒न्ती॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: ato ha tvaṃ naḥ parameṇa pānasya śataṃ naḥ santī namo ||

translations.english: Therefore, indeed, may you grant us the highest protection. May we have a hundred (years of prosperity). Salutations.

verses.original: त्वम॑ग्ने रु॒द्रः शम्व॑त्सु॒ नृम॑णं॒ नमो॑ दे॒वाय॑ शम्भू॒काय॑ च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: tvamaghne rudraḥ śamvatsu nṛmaṇaṃ namo devāya śambhūkāya ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: O Agni, you are Rudra, bringing happiness and good to men. Salutations to the God who is the source of happiness and bliss.

verses.original: नमः॑ क॒पाल॑वते च॒ नमो॑ विश्वे॑श्वराय च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namaḥ kapālavate ca namo viśveśvarāya ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the one holding a skull (Kapālavat). Salutations to the Lord of the universe (Viśveśvara). Salutations.

verses.original: नम॑श्शि॒वाय॑ च शि॒वत॑राय च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namaśśivāya ca śivatarāya ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the Auspicious one (Śiva) and to the most Auspicious one.

verses.original: नम॑ इ॒न्द्राय॑ च॒ नमो॒ वाय॑ve च॒ नमो॑ म॒न्त्र्या॑य च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: nama indrāya ca namo vāyave ca namo mantryāya ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to Indra and to Vāyu. Salutations to the counselor.

verses.original: नमः॑ पू॒र्वाय॑ च॒ पश्चा॑य च॒ नमो॒ दक्षि॑णाय चोत्त॒राय॑ च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namaḥ pūrvāya ca paścāya ca namo dakṣiṇāya cottarāya ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the one in the east and the one in the west. Salutations to the one in the south and the one in the north.

verses.original: नमो॑ दे॒वाय॑ च॒ देवीं च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo devāya ca devīm̐ ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the God and to the Goddess. Salutations.

verses.original: नमो॒ मह॒ते च॑ क्षुल्ल॒काय॑ च॒ नमो॑ वृ॒द्धाय॑ च वरू॒थिने॑ च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo mahate ca kṣullakāya ca namo vṛddhāya ca varūthine ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the great and to the small. Salutations to the old (ancient) and to the one with protective covering.

verses.original: नमः॑ पृ॒ष्ठ्या॑य च॒ नाड्या॑य च॒ नमो॑ भ॒व॑य च रु॒द्राय॑ च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namaḥ pṛṣṭhyāya ca nāḍyāya ca namo bhavāya ca rudrāya ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the one on the surface (the ridge) and the one in the channels (veins). Salutations to Bhava and to Rudra.

verses.original: नम॑स्सुvi॒त्तेभ्यो॒ दुर्वि॒त्तेभ्य॑श्च वो॒ नमो॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namassuvittebhyo durvittebhyaśca vo namo namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to those with good wealth and to those with bad wealth. Salutations.

verses.original: नम॑ इषु॒कृद्भ्यो॑ धन्कृ॒द्भ्यश्च॑ वो॒ नमो॒ नमः॑ मृग॒युभ्यः॑ श्व॒निभ्य॑श्च वो॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: nama iṣukṛdbhyo dhankṛdbhyaśca vo namo namaḥ mṛgayubhyaḥ śvanibhyaśca vo namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the arrow makers and to the bow makers. Salutations to the hunters and to the dog-keepers (or those who live by dogs).

translations.english: Salutations to Thee, O Lord, the Lord of the universe, the Great God, the three-eyed one, the destroyer of Tripura, the annihilator of the three fires, Rudra as the fire of time, the blue-throated one, the conqueror of death, the Lord of all, the ever-auspicious one, the glorious Great God. Salutations.

chapters.name: Namakam - Anuvaka 11 (Final Submission and Benediction)
chapters.summary: The concluding section of Namakam is a final submission to Rudra. It seeks protection for cows and men, and asks for the cessation of His fierce actions. It concludes with an assurance of happiness and well-being for the devotee.

translations.english: Salutations to the **oldest** and the **youngest**. Salutations to the one **born before** (Pūrvaja) and the one **born after** (Aparaja).

verses.original: नमो॑ मध्य॒माय॑ चापग॒ल्भाय॑ च॒ नमो॑ जघ॒न्या॑य च॒ बुध्नि॒याय॑ च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo madhyamāya cāpagalbhāya ca namo jaghanyāya ca budhniyāya ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the **middle** one and the **immature** one. Salutations to the one in the **background** and the one in the **foundation** (or depth).

verses.original: नमः॑ शो॒भ्या॑y च प्रतिस॒र्या॑य च॒ नमो॒ याम्या॑य च॒ क्षेम्या॑य च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namaḥ śobhyāya ca pratisaryāya ca namo yāmyāya ca kṣemyāya ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the one born in the **assembly** and the one who **moves around**. Salutations to the one in the **south** (Yama's direction) and the one in the **safety** (or well-being).

verses.original: नम॑ उ॒र्वर्या॑य च॒ खल्या॑य च॒ नमः॒ श्लोक्या॑य चाऽवसा॒न्याय॑ च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: nama urvaryāya ca khalyāya ca namaḥ ślokyāya cā'vasānyāya ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the one in the **fields** and the one in the **threshing floor**. Salutations to the **famous** one and the one at the **end** (or cessation).

verses.original: नमो॒ वन्या॑य च॒ कक्ष्या॑य च॒ नमः॑ श्र॒वाय॑ च प्रतिश्र॒वाय॑ च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo vanyāya ca kakṣyāya ca namaḥ śravāya ca pratiśravāya ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the one in the **forest** and the one in the **thicket**. Salutations to the one who is **heard** (fame) and the one who **responds** (echo).

verses.original: नम॑ आ॒शुषे॑णाय चा॒शुर॑थाय च॒ नमः॑ शू॒राय॑ चावभिन्द॒ते च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: nama āśuṣeṇāya cāśurathāya ca namaḥ śūrāya cāvabhindate ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the one with a **swift army** and the one with a **swift chariot**. Salutations to the **hero** and the one who **pierces through** (the enemy lines).

verses.original: नमो॑ वर्मि॒णे च॑ वरू॒थिने॑ च॒ नमः॑ प्रकृ॒तीनां॒ पत॑ye च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo varmiṇe ca varūthine ca namaḥ prakṛtīnāṃ pataye ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the one wearing **armor** and the one wearing **protective gear**. Salutations to the **lord of nature** (Prakṛtis) and the creatures.

chapters.name: Chamakam - Anuvaka 1 (Requests for Spiritual & Material Needs)
chapters.summary: Chamakam begins with requests for strength, food, spiritual effort, resolve, fame, hearing (knowledge), light, and austerity. The pervasive phrase is 'cha me' (and to me), asking for the bestowal of hundreds of auspicious items.

verses.original: अ॒ग्निरि॑न्द्रो॒ बृहस्पति॒र्वरु॑णो मि॒त्रो अ॑र्य॒मा सवि॒ता रु॒द्रस्त्वष्टा॒ पू॒षा भगो॒ नमो॒ विश्व॑दे॒वा म॒रुतो॒ ब्रह्म॒ सोमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: agnir indro bṛhaspatir varuṇo mitro aryamā savitā rudras tvaṣṭā pūṣā bhago namo viśvadevā maruto brahma somaḥ ||

translations.english: May Agni, Indra, Brihaspati, Varuna, Mitra, Aryaman, Savita, Rudra, Tvashta, Pushan, Bhaga, the Visvedevas, the Maruts, Brahman, and Soma grant me success.

verses.original: इ॒दं च॒ नमो॑ दे॒वानां᳚ हृद॒येभ्यो॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: idaṁ ca namo devānām̐ hṛdayebhyo namaḥ ||

translations.english: This (sacrifice) also, salutations to the hearts of the gods. Salutations.

verses.original: शन्नो॑ वातः॒ शन्नो॑ भूमिः॒ शन्नः॑ सूर्यः॒ शन्नो॑ दे॒वः ॥
verses.transliteration: śanno vātaḥ śanno bhūmiḥ śannaḥ sūryaḥ śanno devaḥ ||

translations.english: May the Wind be auspicious to us, may the Earth be auspicious to us, may the Sun be auspicious to us, may the Divine be auspicious to us.

verses.original: स॒हस्र॑म॒स्य॒ त्वक्षा॑ दे॒वस्य॑ म॒हादे॒वस्य॑ म॒हादे॒वाय॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: sahasram asya tvakṣā devasya mahādevasya mahādevāya namaḥ ||

translations.english: Thousands are the aspects of this God, Mahadeva. Salutations to Mahadeva.

verses.original: दे॒वा व॑स्तो॒रि॒दं त्वा॒ नमो॒ विश्व॑दे॒वा म॒रुतो॒ ब्रह्म॒ सोमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: devā vastor idam̐ tvā namo viśvadevā maruto brahma somaḥ ||

translations.english: O Gods, this is for you. Salutations to the Visvedevas, the Maruts, Brahman, and Soma.

verses.original: वाज॑श्च मे प्रस॒वश्च॑ मे॒ प्रय॑तिश्च मे॒ प्रसी॑तिश्च मे धी॒tiśca॑ मे॒ क्रतु॑श्च मे॒ स्वर॑श्च मे॒ श्लोक॑श्च मे॒ श्राव॑श्च मे॒ श्रुति॑श्च मे॒ ज्योति॑श्च मे॒ सुव॑श्च मे॒ प्रा॒णश्च मेऽपा॒नश्च मे व्या॒नश्च मे॑ ऽसु॒श्च मे चि॒त्तं च॒ म आ॑धी॒तं च॑ मे॒ वाक्च॑ मे॒ मन॑श्च मे॒ चक्षु॑श्च मे॒ श्रोत्रं॑ च मे॒ दक्ष॑श्च मे॒ बलं॑ च म॒ ओज॑श्च मे॒ सह॑श्च म॒ आयु॑श्च मे ज॒रा च॑ मे त॒नूश्च॑ मे॒ शर्म॑ च मे॒ वर्म॑ च मे॒ ऽङ्गा॑नि च मे॒ ऽस्थीनि॑ च मे॒ परूँ॑षि च मे॒ शरी॑राणि च मे ॥
verses.transliteration: vājaśca me prasavaśca me prayatiśca me prasītiśca me dhītiśca me kratuśca me svarśca me ślokaśca me śrāvaśca me śrutiśca me jyotiśca me suvaśca me prāṇaśca me’pānaśca me vyānaśca me ‘suśca me cittaṃ ca ma ādhītaṃ ca me vākca me manaśca me cakṣuśca me śrotraṃ ca me dakṣaśca me balaṃ ca ma ojaśca me sahaśca ma āyuśca me jarā ca me tanūśca me śarma ca me varma ca me ‘ṅgāni ca me ‘sthīni ca me parūm̐ṣi ca me śarīrāṇi ca me ||

translations.english: May food be mine, and its production be mine, and effort be mine, and success be mine, and thought power be mine, and determination be mine, and voice be mine, and fame be mine, and hearing be mine, and sight be mine, and light be mine, and heaven be mine. May Prāṇa (life-breath) be mine, and Apāna (down-breath) be mine, and Vyāna (pervading-breath) be mine, and life-force be mine, and consciousness be mine, and memory be mine, and speech be mine, and mind be mine, and sight be mine, and hearing be mine, and skill be mine, and strength be mine, and vitality be mine, and conquering power be mine, and long life be mine, and old age be mine, and body be mine, and protection be mine, and armor be mine, and limbs be mine, and bones be mine, and joints be mine, and bodies be mine.

verses.original: शं नः॑ क॒रोति॑ त॒च्छं करं॑ मे ॥
verses.transliteration: śaṁ naḥ karoti taccham̐karaṁ me ||

translations.english: May He make happiness for us; may He make that happiness mine.

verses.original: च॒न्द्रम॑श्च मे सू॒र्यश्च॑ मे म॒ृत्युश्च॑ मे॒ जीवा॑तुश्च मे ॥
verses.transliteration: candramaśca me sūryaśca me mṛtyuśca me jīvātuśca me ||

translations.english: May the Moon be mine, and the Sun be mine, and death be mine (avoided), and life be mine.

verses.original: अ॒न्ना॑य॒ नमो॒ नमो॒ नमो॒ नमो॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: annāyā namo namo namo namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to Food, salutations, salutations, salutations.

verses.original: या दे॒वी प॑रि॒णम॑न्ते॒ नमो॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: yā devī pariṇamante namo namaḥ ||

translations.english: The Goddesses who turn around (or fulfill desires). Salutations, salutations.

verses.original: ये प्र॒ाणास्तस्य॑ दे॒वस्य॑ म॒हादे॒वस्य॑ म॒हादे॒वाय॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: ye prāṇās tasya devasya mahādevasya mahādevāya namaḥ ||

translations.english: The life-breaths that belong to that God, Mahadeva. Salutations to Mahadeva.

verses.original: अ॒न्ना॒ना॒म॒ये॒ नमो॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: annānāmaye namo namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the granter of food (Annāmaya). Salutations, salutations.

verses.original: सं॒व॒त्स॒रश्च॑ मे प॒रि॒व॒त्स॒रश्च॑ मे॒ इ॒दा॑व॒त्स॒रश्च॑ मे ॥
verses.transliteration: sam̐vatsaraśca me parivatsaraśca me idāvatsaraśca me ||

translations.english: May the year (Samvatsara) be mine, and the following year (Parivatsara) be mine, and the next year (Idāvatsara) be mine.

verses.original: आ॒ग्ने॒य॒श्च॒ मे॒ सौ॒म्य॑श्च मे बार्हस्प॒त्य॑श्च मे ॥
verses.transliteration: āgneyaśca me saumyaśca me bārhaspatyaśca me ||

translations.english: May the things pertaining to Agni be mine, and those pertaining to Soma be mine, and those pertaining to Brihaspati be mine.

chapters.name: Chamakam - Anuvaka 2 (Requests for Health and Protection)
chapters.summary: Prayers for health (immunity from disease), protection from fear, and requests for physical strength, vigor, longevity, and the necessary energy for ritual performance are made in this section.

verses.original: इ॒ष्टिश्च॑ मे पू॒र्तं च॑ मे॒ रन्तं॑ च मे॒ रमि॑तिश्च मे॒ शं च॑ मे॒ शर्म॑ च मे॒ वर्म॑ च मे॒ वर्म॑ च मे॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: iṣṭiśca me pūrtaṃ ca me rantaṃ ca me ramitiśca me śaṃ ca me śarma ca me varma ca me varma ca me namaḥ ||

translations.english: May the sacrificial offering (Iṣṭi) be mine, and fulfillment (Pūrta) be mine, and joy be mine, and comfort be mine, and welfare (Śam) be mine, and shelter (Śarma) be mine, and armor (Varma) be mine. Salutations.

verses.original: भू॒तये॑ च मे॒ नमः॒ पृथिव्यै॑ च मे॒ नमः॒ श्रुत्यै॑ च मे॒ नमः॒ ज्योति॑षे च मे॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: bhūtaye ca me namaḥ pṛthivyai ca me namaḥ śrutyai ca me namaḥ jyotiṣe ca me namaḥ ||

translations.english: May prosperity (Bhūti) be mine. Salutations to Earth. Salutations to hearing. Salutations to Light (Jyoti).

verses.original: सु॒वश्च॑ मे॒ प्रा॒णश्च मेऽपा॒नश्च मे व्या॒नश्च मेऽसु॒श्च मे चि॒त्तं च॒ म आ॑धी॒तं च॑ मे॒ वाक्च॑ मे॒ मन॑श्च मे॒ चक्षु॑श्च मे॒ श्रोत्रं॑ च मे ॥
verses.transliteration: suvaśca me prāṇaśca me’pānaśca me vyānaśca me’suśca me cittaṃ ca ma ādhītaṃ ca me vākca me manaśca me cakṣuśca me śrotraṃ ca me ||

translations.english: May Heaven be mine. May Prāṇa (life-breath) be mine, Apāna (down-breath) be mine, Vyāna (pervading-breath) be mine, life-force (Asu) be mine, consciousness (Citta) be mine, memory (Ādhīta) be mine, speech (Vāk) be mine, mind (Manas) be mine, sight (Cakṣu) be mine, and hearing (Śrotra) be mine.

verses.original: दक्ष॑श्च मे॒ बलं॑ च म॒ ओज॑श्च मे॒ सह॑श्च म॒ आयु॑श्च मे ज॒रा च॑ मे ॥
verses.transliteration: dakṣaśca me balaṃ ca ma ojaśca me sahaśca ma āyuśca me jarā ca me ||

translations.english: May skill (Dakṣa) be mine, and strength (Bala) be mine, and vitality (Oja) be mine, and conquering power (Sahas) be mine, and life (Āyu) be mine, and old age (Jarā) be mine.

verses.original: त॒नूश्च॑ मे॒ शर्म॑ च मे॒ वर्म॑ च मे॒ ऽङ्गा॑नि च मे॒ ऽस्थीनि॑ च मे॒ परूँ॑षि च मे॒ शरी॑राणि च मे ॥
verses.transliteration: tanūśca me śarma ca me varma ca me ‘ṅgāni ca me ‘sthīni ca me parūm̐ṣi ca me śarīrāṇi ca me ||

translations.english: May the body (Tanū) be mine, and protection (Śarma) be mine, and armor (Varma) be mine, and limbs (Aṅgāni) be mine, and bones (Asthīni) be mine, and joints (Parūm̐ṣi) be mine, and bodies (Śarīrāṇi) be mine.

verses.original: ज्यैष्ठ्यं॑ च म॒ आधि॑पत्यं च मे म॒न्युश्च॑ मे॒ भाम॑श्च मे॒ ऽमश्च॑ मे॒ ऽम्भश्च॑ मे जे॒मा च॑ मे महि॒मा च॑ मे वरद॒श्च॑ मे॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: jyáiṣṭhyaṃ ca ma ádhipatyaṃ ca me manyúśca me bhā́maśca me ‘máśca me ‘mbháśca me jé́mā ca me mahimā́ ca me varadaśca me namaḥ ||

translations.english: May supremacy (Jyaiṣṭhya) be mine, and dominion (Ādhipatya) be mine, and wrath (Manyu) be mine, and fury (Bhāma) be mine, and strength (Ama) be mine, and water (Ambha) be mine, and victory (Jemā) be mine, and greatness (Mahimā) be mine, and may I be a giver of boons. Salutations.

verses.original: वरि॒मा च॑ मे प्रथ॒मा च॑ मे दि॒तिश्च॑ मे॒ नमः॒ श्रुत्यै॑ च मे॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: varimā ca me prathamā ca me ditiśca me namaḥ śrutyai ca me namaḥ ||

translations.english: May excellence (Varimā) be mine, and precedence (Prathamā) be mine, and freedom (Diti) be mine. Salutations to Vedic knowledge.

verses.original: व॒र्तनि॑श्च मे॒ नम॑ ऋ॒तव॑श्च मे॒ नम॑स्त्वे॒षाय॑ च मे॒ नम॑स्तोभ॒काय॑ च मे॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: vartaniśca me nama ṛtavaśca me namastveṣāya ca me namastobhakāya ca me namaḥ ||

translations.english: May the path (Vartani) be mine. Salutations to the seasons (Ṛtava). Salutations to the shining one (Tveṣa). Salutations to the singing one (Tobhaka).

verses.original: वृष्टि॑श्च मे॒ नमः॑ क्ष॒मे च॑ मे॒ नमः॑ श्र॒वाय॑ च मे॒ नमः॒ श्रुत्यै॑ च मे॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: vṛṣṭiśca me namaḥ kṣame ca me namaḥ śravāya ca me namaḥ śrutyai ca me namaḥ ||

translations.english: May rain (Vṛṣṭi) be mine. Salutations to the earth (Kṣama). Salutations to fame (Śrava). Salutations to Vedic knowledge (Śruti).

verses.original: ज्योति॑श्च मे॒ सुव॑श्च मे॒ प्र॒णाश्च॑ मे॒ त्वां च॑ मे॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: jyotiśca me suvaśca me prāṇāśca me tvām̐ ca me namaḥ ||

translations.english: May light be mine, and heaven be mine, and the life-breaths be mine, and You be mine. Salutations.

verses.original: य ईशा॑न॒स्य॒ भुवन॑स्य वि॒राट् इ॒ह स॑र्वव्या॒पी नम॑स्सदाशि॒वाय॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: ya īśānasyā bhuvanasya virāṭ iha sarvavyāpī namassadāśivāya ||

translations.english: He who is the Sovereign Ruler of the universe, the all-pervading one here. Salutations to Sadashiva.

verses.original: नमः॑ क॒पाल॑वते च॒ नमो॑ विश्वे॑श्वराय च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namaḥ kapālavate ca namo viśveśvarāya ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the one holding a skull (Kapālavat). Salutations to the Lord of the universe (Viśveśvara). Salutations.

verses.original: नमस्ते॑ अस्तु भगवन् विश्वेश्वराय महादे॒वाय॑ त्र्यम्ब॒काय॑ त्रिपुरान्त॒काय॑ त्रिकाग्निका॒लाय॑ कालाग्निरु॒द्राय॑ नीलक॒ण्ठाय॑ मृत्युञ्ज॒याय॑ सर्वेश्व॒राय॑ सदाशि॒वाय॑ श्रीमन्म॒हादे॒वाय॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namaste astu bhagavan viśveśvarāya mahādevāya tryambakāya tripurāntakāya trikāgnikālāya kālāgnirudrāya nīlakaṇṭhāya mṛtyuñjayāya sarveśvarāya sadāśivāya śrīmanmahādevāya namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to Thee, O Lord, the Lord of the universe, the Great God, the three-eyed one, the destroyer of Tripura, the annihilator of the three fires, Rudra as the fire of time, the blue-throated one, the conqueror of death, the Lord of all, the ever-auspicious one, the glorious Great God. Salutations.

verses.original: दे॒वा व॑स्तो॒रि॒दं त्वा॒ नमो॒ विश्व॑दे॒वा म॒रुतो॒ ब्रह्म॒ सोमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: devā vastor idam̐ tvā namo viśvadevā maruto brahma somaḥ ||

translations.english: O Gods, this is for you. Salutations to the Visvedevas, the Maruts, Brahman, and Soma.

verses.original: यज॑मानाय मे॒ नमो॒ यज॑मानाय॒ मे॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: yajamānāya me namo yajamānāya me namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the Sacrificer (Yajamāna) be mine. Salutations to the Sacrificer be mine. Salutations.

chapters.name: Chamakam - Anuvaka 3 (Requests for Prosperity and Resources)
chapters.summary: This Anuvaka requests prosperity in the form of cattle, wealth, offspring, stable social status, and various forms of material abundance necessary for a fulfilling life.

verses.original: अं॒शुश्च॑ मे र॒श्मिश्च॑ मे॒ ऽदा॑भ्र्यश्च मे॒ ऽधि॑पतिश्च मे ॥
verses.transliteration: aṁśúśca me raśmíśca me ‘dábhryaśca me ‘dhípatiśca me ||

translations.english: May the **stalk** (Aṁśu) be mine, and the **ray** (Raśmi) be mine, and the **undeceiving** (Adābhrya) measure be mine, and **lordship** (Adhipati) be mine.

verses.original: सं॒व॒त्स॒रश्च॑ मे प॒रि॒व॒त्स॒रश्च॑ मे॒ इ॒दा॑व॒त्स॒रश्च॑ मे॒ इ॒द्वत्स॒रश्च॑ मे व॒त्स॒रश्च॑ मे ॥
verses.transliteration: saṁvatsaráśca me parivatsaráśca me iḍāvatsaráśca me idvatsaráśca me vatsaráśca me ||

translations.english: May the **Year** (Saṁvatsara) be mine, and the **following year** (Parivatsara) be mine, and the **next year** (Iḍāvatsara) be mine, and the **year after that** (Idvatsara) be mine, and the **season** (Vatsara) be mine.

verses.original: इ॒ष्टिश्च॑ मे पू॒र्तं च॑ मे॒ रन्तं॑ च मे॒ नमः॒ श्रुत्यै॑ च मे॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: iṣṭiśca me pūrtaṁ ca me rantaṁ ca me namaḥ śrutyai ca me namaḥ ||

translations.english: May **offering** (Iṣṭi) be mine, and **fulfillment** (Pūrta) be mine, and **joy** (Ranta) be mine. Salutations to Vedic knowledge.

verses.original: अ॒ग्निश्च॑ मे॒ इन्द्र॑श्च मे॒ सोम॑श्च मे॒ सवि॒ता च॑ मे॒ सर॑स्वती च मे पू॒षा च॑ मे ॥
verses.transliteration: agníś ca ma indráśca me sómaśca me savitā́ ca me sárasvatī ca me pūṣā́ ca me ||

translations.english: May **Agni** be mine, and **Indra** be mine, and **Soma** be mine, and **Savita** (Sun) be mine, and **Sarasvati** be mine, and **Pushan** be mine.

verses.original: बृह॒स्पति॑श्च मे॒ वरु॑णश्च मे॒ त्वष्टा॑ च मे धा॒ता च॑ मे॒ विष्ण॑श्च मे॒ ऽश्विनौ॑ च मे म॒रुत॑श्च मे वि॒श्वे च॑ मे दे॒वाः ॥
verses.transliteration: bṛhaspátis ca me váruṇaś ca me tvaṣṭā́ ca me dhātā́ ca me víṣṇuś ca me aśvínau ca me marútaś ca me víśve ca me devā́ḥ ||

translations.english: May **Brihaspati** be mine, and **Varuna** be mine, and **Tvashta** be mine, and **Dhata** be mine, and **Vishnu** be mine, and the **Asvins** be mine, and the **Maruts** be mine, and the **Visvedevas** be mine.

verses.original: पृथि॒वी च॑ मे॒ ऽन्तरि॑क्षं च मे॒ द्यौश्च॑ मे॒ दिश॑श्च मे॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: pṛthivī́ ca me antárikṣaṁ ca me dyaúśca me díśaśca me namaḥ ||

translations.english: May **Earth** (Pṛthivī) be mine, and the **Atmosphere** (Antarikṣam) be mine, and **Heaven** (Dyaus) be mine, and the **Quarters** (Diśa) be mine. Salutations.

verses.original: आर॒ण्यैश्च॑ मे ग्राम्यैश्च मे प॒शav॑श्च मे ॥
verses.transliteration: āraṇyáiśca me grāmyáiśca me paśávaśca me ||

translations.english: May the **wild** (Āraṇya) animals be mine, and the **domesticated** (Grāmya) animals be mine, and **cattle** (Paśava) be mine.

verses.original: यवा॒श्च मे॒ यवा॑श्च मे॒ माषा॑श्च मे॒ तिला॑श्च मे ॥
verses.transliteration: yávā́śca me yávā́śca me mā́ṣāśca me tílāśca me ||

translations.english: May **barley** (Yava) be mine, and **kidney beans** (Yava) be mine, and **black gram** (Māṣa) be mine, and **sesame** (Tila) be mine.

verses.original: प्रियं॑गवश्च मे॒ ऽणव॑श्च मे म॒स्रश्च॑ मे गो॒धूमा॑श्च मे ॥
verses.transliteration: priyaṁgávaśca me áṇavaśca me masráśca me godhū́māśca me ||

translations.english: May **foxtail millet** (Priyaṁgava) be mine, and **fine rice** (Aṇava) be mine, and **lentils** (Masra) be mine, and **wheat** (Godhūma) be mine.

verses.original: तण्डु॑लाश्च मे भ॒द्रश्च॑ मे॒ नमो॒ नमः॒ श्रुत्यै॑ च मे॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: taṇḍulāśca me bhadraśca me namo namaḥ śrutyai ca me namaḥ ||

translations.english: May **rice grains** (Taṇḍula) be mine, and **auspiciousness** (Bhadra) be mine. Salutations, salutations to Vedic knowledge.

verses.original: हिर॑ण्यं च मे॒ ऽयश्च॑ मे॒ लोहं॑ च मे॒ सीसं॑ च मे॒ त्रपु॑श्च मे॒ श्यामं॑ च मे ॥
verses.transliteration: híraṇyaṁ ca me áyaśca me lóhaṁ ca me sī́saṁ ca me trápuśca me śyāmáṁ ca me ||

translations.english: May **gold** (Hiraṇya) be mine, and **iron** (Ayas) be mine, and **copper** (Loha) be mine, and **lead** (Sīsa) be mine, and **tin** (Trapu) be mine, and **dark iron** (Śyāma) be mine.

verses.original: शु॒क्रं च॑ मे॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: śukráṁ ca me namaḥ ||

translations.english: May the **bright** (pure, Śukra) be mine. Salutations.

verses.original: प॒शुश्च॑ मे॒ नमः॑ क्ष॒मे च॑ मे॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: paśuśca me namaḥ kṣame ca me namaḥ ||

translations.english: May **cattle** (Paśu) be mine. Salutations to **Earth** (Kṣama). Salutations.

verses.original: य॒ज्ञेन॑ क॒ल्पन्तां॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: yajñéna kalpantām̐ namaḥ ||

translations.english: May they be **established** by the sacrifice. Salutations.

verses.original: इ॒ष्टिश्च॑ मे पू॒र्तं च॑ मे॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: iṣṭiśca me pūrtaṁ ca me namaḥ ||

translations.english: May **offering** (Iṣṭi) be mine, and **fulfillment** (Pūrta) be mine. Salutations.

chapters.name: Chamakam - Anuvaka 4 (Requests for Heavenly Blessings)
chapters.summary: Requests are made for blessings from the heavens, including rain, seasons, moon, stars, and celestial light. It links the fulfillment of human desires to the harmony of cosmic forces.

verses.original: आय॑श्च मे॒ गति॑श्च मे॒ दीप्ति॑श्च मे॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: āyáśca me gátiśca me dī́ptiśca me namaḥ ||

translations.english: May **income** (Āya) be mine, and **progress** (Gati) be mine, and **splendor** (Dīpti) be mine. Salutations.

verses.original: क्षुध॑श्च मे॒ पिपा॑सा च मे॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: kṣudháśca me pípāsā ca me namaḥ ||

translations.english: May freedom from **hunger** (Kṣudh) be mine, and freedom from **thirst** (Pipāsā) be mine. Salutations.

verses.original: शन्न॑स्so॒मो भ॑वतु॒ शं न॒ इन्द्रा॒ग्नी शं नः॒ पू॒षा शं नः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: śánnas sómo bhavatu śáṁ na indrāgnī śáṁ naḥ pūṣā́ śáṁ naḥ ||

translations.english: May **Soma** be auspicious to us, may **Indra and Agni** be auspicious to us, may **Pūṣan** be auspicious to us.

verses.original: अ॒प्श्च मे॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: aps ca me namaḥ ||

translations.english: May **waters** (Ap) be mine. Salutations.

verses.original: ऊ॒र्क्च मे सू॒नृता॑ च मे॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: ū́rkca me sūnṛ́tā ca me namaḥ ||

translations.english: May **nourishment** (Ūrk) be mine, and **pleasant speech** (Sūnṛtā) be mine. Salutations.

verses.original: घृ॒तं च॑ मे॒ मधु॑ च मे॒ सग्धि॑श्च मे॒ सपी॑तिश्च मे कृ॒षिश्च॑ मे॒ वृष्टि॑श्च मे॒ जैत्रं॑ च म॒ औद्भि॑द्यं च मे र॒यिश्च॑ मे॒ राय॑श्च मे पु॒ष्टं च॑ मे॒ पुष्टि॑श्च मे वि॒भु च॑ मे प्र॒भु च॑ मे ब॒हु च॑ मे भू॒यश्च॑ मे ॥
verses.transliteration: ghṛtáṁ ca me mádhu ca me sagdhíśca me sapī́tiśca me kṛṣíśca me vṛṣṭíśca me jáitraṁ ca ma audbhídyaṁ ca me rayíśca me rāyáśca me puṣṭáṁ ca me púṣṭiśca me vibhú ca me prabhú ca me bahú ca me bhūyáśca me ||

translations.english: May **ghee** (Ghṛtam) be mine, and **honey** (Madhu) be mine, and **dining together** (Sagdhí) be mine, and **drinking together** (Sapīti) be mine. May **ploughing** (Kṛṣi) be mine, and **rain** (Vṛṣṭi) be mine, and **victory** (Jaitra) be mine, and **sprouting** (Audbhidya) be mine. May **wealth** (Rayi) be mine, and **treasures** (Rāya) be mine, and **nourishment** (Puṣṭam) be mine, and **growth** (Puṣṭi) be mine. May **abundance** (Vibhu) be mine, and **greatness** (Prabhu) be mine, and **much** (Bahu) be mine, and **more** (Bhūyas) be mine.

verses.original: पू॒र्णं च॑ मे पू॒र्णत॑रं च मे॒ ऽक्षि॑तिश्च मे॒ कूय॑वं च मे॒ ऽन्नं च॑ मे॒ ऽक्षुच्च॑ मे॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: pūrṇáṁ ca me pūrṇatáraṁ ca me ákṣitiśca me kūyávaṁ ca me ánnaṁ ca me ákṣucca me namaḥ ||

translations.english: May **fullness** (Pūrṇam) be mine, and **greater fullness** (Pūrṇataram) be mine, and **freedom from decay** (Akṣiti) be mine, and **freedom from suffering** (Kūyavam) be mine, and **food** (Annam) be mine, and **freedom from hunger** (Akṣut) be mine. Salutations.

verses.original: वृष्टि॑श्च मे॒ नमः॑ क्ष॒me च॑ मे॒ नमः॑ श्रुत्यै॑ च मे॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: vṛṣṭíśca me namaḥ kṣáme ca me namaḥ śrutyai ca me namaḥ ||

translations.english: May **rain** (Vṛṣṭi) be mine. Salutations to **Earth** (Kṣama). Salutations to **Vedic knowledge** (Śruti). Salutations.

verses.original: प॒शुश्च॑ मे॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: paśuśca me namaḥ ||

translations.english: May **cattle** (Paśu) be mine. Salutations.

verses.original: च॒न्द्रम॑श्च मे सू॒र्यश्च॑ मे म॒ृत्युश्च॑ मे॒ जीवा॑तुश्च मे ॥
verses.transliteration: candrámaśca me sū́ryaśca me mṛtyúśca me jīvātuśca me ||

translations.english: May the **Moon** (Candramas) be mine, and the **Sun** (Sūrya) be mine, and **death** (conquered) be mine, and **life** (Jīvātu) be mine.

verses.original: अ॒न्ना॑य॒ नमो॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: annāyā namo namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to **Food** (Anna). Salutations, salutations.

verses.original: नमो॒ यज॑मानाय मे॒ नमो॒ नमो॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo yajamānāya me namo namo ||

translations.english: Salutations to the **Sacrificer** (Yajamāna) be mine. Salutations, salutations.

verses.original: आ॒ग्ने॒य॒श्च॒ मे॒ सौ॒म्य॑श्च मे बार्हस्प॒त्य॑श्च मे ॥
verses.transliteration: āgneyaśca me saumyaśca me bārhaspatyaśca me ||

translations.english: May the things pertaining to **Agni** be mine, and those pertaining to **Soma** be mine, and those pertaining to **Brihaspati** be mine.

verses.original: स॒त्यं च॑ मे श्र॒द्धा च॑ मे॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: satyáṁ ca me śraddhā́ ca me namaḥ ||

translations.english: May **Truth** (Satyam) be mine, and **Faith** (Śraddhā) be mine. Salutations.

verses.original: यज॑मानाय मे॒ नमो॒ यज॑मानाय॒ मे॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: yajamānāya me namo yajamānāya me namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the **Sacrificer** (Yajamāna) be mine. Salutations to the Sacrificer be mine. Salutations.

chapters.name: Chamakam - Anuvaka 5 (Requests for Ritual Items)
chapters.summary: This section specifically requests all items and means essential for performing Vedic sacrifices and rituals, such as clarified butter, rice, wheat, and the tools of worship.

verses.original: अ॒श्मा च॑ मे॒ मृत्ति॑का च मे गि॒रय॑श्च मे॒ पर्व॑ताश्च मे॒ सिक॑ताश्च मे॒ वन॒स्पत॑यश्च मे ॥
verses.transliteration: aśmā́ ca me mṛttikā́ ca me gírayaśca me párvatāśca me síkatāśca me vanaspátayaśca me ||

translations.english: May **stone** (Aśmā) be mine, and **clay** (Mṛttikā) be mine, and **hills** (Giraya) be mine, and **mountains** (Parvata) be mine, and **sand** (Sikatā) be mine, and **forest trees** (Vanaspati) be mine.

verses.original: हिर॑ण्यं च मे॒ ऽयश्च॑ मे॒ लोहं॑ च मे॒ सीसं॑ च मे॒ त्रपु॑श्च मे॒ श्यामं॑ च मे॒ लोहं॑ च मे॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: híraṇyaṁ ca me áyaśca me lóhaṁ ca me sī́saṁ ca me trápuśca me śyāmáṁ ca me lóhaṁ ca me namaḥ ||

translations.english: May **gold** (Hiraṇya) be mine, and **iron** (Ayas) be mine, and **copper** (Loha) be mine, and **lead** (Sīsa) be mine, and **tin** (Trapu) be mine, and **dark iron** (Śyāma) be mine, and **copper** (Loha) be mine. Salutations.

verses.original: मे॒धश्च॑ मे॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: medháśca me namaḥ ||

translations.english: May **sacrificial fat/offering** (Medha) be mine. Salutations.

verses.original: ब्रह्म॑ च मे॒ ब्रह्म॑ च मे॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: brahma ca me brahma ca me namaḥ ||

translations.english: May **Vedic lore** (Brahma) be mine, and **Vedic lore** be mine. Salutations.

verses.original: च॒न्द्रम॑श्च मे सू॒र्यश्च॑ मे म॒ृत्युश्च॑ मे॒ जीवा॑tuश्च मे ॥
verses.transliteration: candrámaśca me sū́ryaśca me mṛtyúśca me jīvātuśca me ||

translations.english: May the **Moon** be mine, and the **Sun** be mine, and **death** (conquered) be mine, and **life** be mine.

verses.original: ज्योति॑श्च मे॒ सुव॑श्च मे॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: jyótiśca me súvaśca me namaḥ ||

translations.english: May **light** be mine, and **heaven** be mine. Salutations.

verses.original: इ॒ष्टिश्च॑ मे पू॒र्तं च॑ मे॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: iṣṭiśca me pūrtaṁ ca me namaḥ ||

translations.english: May **offering** (Iṣṭi) be mine, and **fulfillment** (Pūrta) be mine. Salutations.

verses.original: वसू॑नि च मे॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: vasūni ca me namaḥ ||

translations.english: May **wealth** (Vasūni) be mine. Salutations.

verses.original: यज॑मानाय मे॒ नमो॒ नमो॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: yajamānāya me namo namo ||

translations.english: Salutations to the **Sacrificer** (Yajamāna) be mine. Salutations, salutations.

verses.original: च॒न्द्रम॑श्च मे सू॒र्यश्च॑ मे म॒ृत्युश्च॑ मे॒ जीवा॑तुश्च मे ॥
verses.transliteration: candrámaśca me sū́ryaśca me mṛtyúśca me jīvātuśca me ||

translations.english: May the **Moon** be mine, and the **Sun** be mine, and **death** (conquered) be mine, and **life** be mine.

verses.original: स॒त्यं च॑ मे श्र॒द्धा च॑ मे॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: satyáṁ ca me śraddhā́ ca me namaḥ ||

translations.english: May **Truth** (Satyam) be mine, and **Faith** (Śraddhā) be mine. Salutations.

verses.original: शन्नो॑ वातः॒ शन्नो॑ भूमिः॒ शन्नः॑ सूर्यः॒ शन्नो॑ दे॒वः ॥
verses.transliteration: śanno vātaḥ śanno bhūmiḥ śannaḥ sūryaḥ śanno devaḥ ||

translations.english: May the **Wind** be auspicious to us, may the **Earth** be auspicious to us, may the **Sun** be auspicious to us, may the **Divine** be auspicious to us.

verses.original: य ईशा॑न॒स्य॒ भुवन॑स्य वि॒राट् इ॒ह स॑र्वव्या॒पी नम॑स्सदाशि॒वाय॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: ya īśānasyā bhuvanasya virāṭ iha sarvavyāpī namassadāśivāya ||

translations.english: He who is the Sovereign Ruler of the universe, the all-pervading one here. Salutations to Sadashiva.

verses.original: नमो॑ दे॒वानां᳚ हृद॒येभ्यो॒ नमो॒ विष्ण॑वे च ककु॒भाय॑ च॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namo devānām̐ hṛdayebhyo namo viṣṇeve ca kakubhāya ca namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to the hearts of the **Gods**. Salutations to **Vishnu** (the pervader) and to the **prominent** one. Salutations.

verses.original: नमस्ते॑ अस्तु भगवन् विश्वेश्वराय महादे॒वाय॑ त्र्यम्ब॒काय॑ त्रिपुरान्त॒काय॑ त्रिकाग्निका॒लाय॑ कालाग्निरु॒द्राय॑ नीलक॒ण्ठाय॑ मृत्युञ्ज॒याय॑ सर्वेश्व॒राय॑ सदाशि॒वाय॑ श्रीमन्म॒हादे॒वाय॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namaste astu bhagavan viśveśvarāya mahādevāya tryambakāya tripurāntakāya trikāgnikālāya kālāgnirudrāya nīlakaṇṭhāya mṛtyuñjayāya sarveśvarāya sadāśivāya śrīmanmahādevāya namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to Thee, O Lord, the Lord of the universe, the Great God, the three-eyed one, the destroyer of Tripura, the annihilator of the three fires, Rudra as the fire of time, the blue-throated one, the conqueror of death, the Lord of all, the ever-auspicious one, the glorious Great God. Salutations.

chapters.name: Chamakam - Anuvaka 6 (Requests for Metals and Minerals)
chapters.summary: A prayer for the attainment of various metals, minerals, and earthly resources (gold, silver, iron, lead, tin, etc.), symbolizing material richness and economic stability.

verses.original: च॒र्वाणि॑ च मे॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: carvāṇi ca me namaḥ ||

translations.english: May the **sacrificial offerings** (Carvāṇi) be mine. Salutations.

verses.original: द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी च॑ मे॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: dyāvāpṛthivī ca me namaḥ ||

translations.english: May **Heaven and Earth** (Dyāvāpṛthivī) be mine. Salutations.

verses.original: शन्न॑स्सो॒मो भ॑वतु॒ शं न॒ इन्द्रा॒ग्नी शं नः॒ पू॒षा शं नः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: śánnas sómo bhavatu śáṁ na indrāgnī śáṁ naḥ pūṣā́ śáṁ naḥ ||

verses.original: प॒शुश्च॑ मे॒ नमः॑ ॥

translations.english: May **cattle** (Paśu) be mine. Salutations.

chapters.name: Chamakam - Anuvaka 7 (Requests for Knowledge and Wisdom)
chapters.summary: This section focuses on spiritual and intellectual boons, requesting knowledge, intelligence, and the realization of ultimate truth, aligning with the hymn's underlying theme of Vedic wisdom.

translations.english: May **twelve** be mine, and **sixteen** be mine. Salutations.

translations.english: May **twenty** be mine, and **twenty-four** be mine. Salutations.

chapters.name: Chamakam - Anuvaka 10 (Requests for Cosmic Elements)
chapters.summary: A prayer for the elements of creation (Earth, Sky, Fire, Wind, etc.) and the vital cosmic energies. It seeks mastery over both the material and spiritual dimensions of existence.

verses.original: य ईशा॑न॒स्य॒ भुवन॑स्य वि॒राट् इ॒ह स॑र्वव्या॒पी नम॑स्सदाशि॒वाय॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: ya īśānasyā bhuvanasya virāṭ iha sarvavyāpī namassadāśivāya ||

translations.english: He who is the Sovereign Ruler of the universe, the all-pervading one here. Salutations to Sadashiva (the ever-auspicious one).

verses.original: नमस्ते॑ अस्तु भगवन् विश्वेश्वराय महादे॒वाय॑ त्र्यम्ब॒काय॑ त्रिपुरान्त॒काय॑ त्रिकाग्निका॒लाय॑ कालाग्निरु॒द्राय॑ नीलक॒ण्ठाय॑ मृत्युञ्ज॒याय॑ सर्वेश्व॒राय॑ सदाशि॒वाय॑ श्रीमन्म॒हादे॒वाय॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namaste astu bhagavan viśveśvarāya mahādevāya tryambakāya tripurāntakāya trikāgnikālāya kālāgnirudrāya nīlakaṇṭhāya mṛtyuñjayāya sarveśvarāya sadāśivāya śrīmanmahādevāya namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to Thee, O Lord, the Lord of the universe, the Great God, the three-eyed one, the destroyer of Tripura, the annihilator of the three fires, Rudra as the fire of time, the blue-throated one, the conqueror of death, the Lord of all, the ever-auspicious one, the glorious Great God. Salutations.

translations.english: May **light** be mine, and **heaven** be mine. Salutations.

translations.english: May the things pertaining to **Agni** be mine, and those pertaining to **Soma** be mine, and those pertaining to **Brihaspati** be mine.

translations.english: May **Truth** (Satyam) be mine, and **Faith** (Śraddhā) be mine. Salutations.

translations.english: May the **Wind** be auspicious to us, may the **Earth** be auspicious to us, may the **Sun** be auspicious to us, may the **Divine** be auspicious to us.

chapters.name: Chamakam - Anuvaka 11 (Final Vows and Fulfillment)
chapters.summary: The concluding Anuvaka renews the commitment to the sacrifice and seeks the ultimate reward: the attainment of the heavenly worlds and immortality (*Amṛta*), completing the goal of the Vedic ritual.
